page.title: 19WELSH LANGUAGE
page.content: WE LIVE IN WALES. WALES HAS ITS OWN LANGUAGE. IN OUR VILLAGE ONLY A FEW PEOPLE SPEAK WELSH,AND, WE ONLY SPEAK IT WHEN WE HAVE LESSONS. ROAD SIGNS AND OFFICIAL LETTERS ARE IN WELSH AND ENGLISH. THE WELSH LANGUAGE IS HARD BUT I LIKE IT. IN MY SURVEY, MOST PEOPLE LIKE THE WELSH LANGUAGE AND THOUGHT IT WOULD NOT DIE OUT, ALTHOUGH NO-ONE SAID THEY WOULD LIKE TO SPEAK IT ALL THE TIME. THE FIRST LANGUAGE OF ALL PENTRE CHILDREN IS ENGLISH, THOUGH THREE CHILDREN DO HEAR WELSH SPOKEN AT HOME. THE WORD 'PENTRE' IS REALLY WELSH FOR VILLAGE. THESE ARE MEANINGS OF SOME WELSH PLACES IN OUR AREA: CEFN BYCHAN...SMALL HUMP. TY MAEN..STONE HOUSE COEDLEOEDD..PLACE OF TREES. CEFN_Y_WERN...BACK OF THE MARSH.
